pageContext.claim: “And I love the unions and I love the workers. And, you know, when I built buildings in New York -- I built them exclusively with unions. People don't understand that. I was exclusive.”
pageContext.analysis: "A review of the presumptive Republican presidential nominee's projects reveals that he hires union when project labor agreements or dominant market share force him to," according to a 2016 report by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers . "But more than 60 percent of his projects developed outside New York City and Atlantic City – which includes most of his recent projects – were built nonunion."
